meanings.sent1: I will start presorting the mail before the post office opens.
meanings.sent2: She always presorts her laundry into different piles before washing them.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel decided to presort his acorns by size and color.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to presort their ideas before writing their essays.
meanings.sent5: Presorting the recycling makes it easier to take out on trash day.

meanings.definition: The act of sorting in advance.
meanings.sent1: The presorting of the documents saved us a lot of time during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Presorting is an important step in streamlining the workflow of the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The presorting of the puzzle pieces made it easier for the kids to put it together.
meanings.sent4: The presorting of the books on the shelves made the library look neat and organized.
meanings.sent5: Presorting the ingredients before cooking helps make the process smoother.
